lead_paragraph: In giving a far-right party up to a quarter of the vote, Germans let their chancellor know they are not happy with how the refugee crisis is being handled.

byline.contributor: Tim Arango and Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

headline.print_headline: German State Elections Point to Growing Vulnerabilities for Merkel
headline.main: German State Elections Point to Vulnerability for Angela Merkel

snippet: In giving a far-right party up to a quarter of the vote, Germans let their chancellor know they are not happy with how the refugee crisis is being handled.
abstract: News analysis; insurgent far-right party makes big gains in German state elections, serving as warning to Chancellor Angela Merkel that Germans are not happy with prospect of integrating million migrants and refugees from wars in Iraq and Syria.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
